The dualist character of the Bourbon realm has caused a great upset in both the French and Spanish sections of the empire a great upset, as both parties considered themselves rightfully the leaders of the union, and much expected the Bourbon realm to merely be an extension of their own. With this, the idea of the Ancien Regime itself being a foreign concept, an occupation by elites of a royalist character, has become increasingly prominent in social circles. Socialists and Communists alike have gained much by capitalizing on this resentment, promoting a separation of the two artificially fused realms. While conservatives and traditionalists alike remain loyal, violence is doubtlessly soon to commence.
This does not bode well.
Bombing of Toulouse

Despite the unpopularity of the Bourbon realm, the last few weeks have still remained somewhat quiet, the unrest in the streets little more than hushed words and quiet assemblies. In recent events, that has finally changed. A public square in Toulouse has been bombed, and moreso by a radical leftist movement proclaiming itself the Occitan People's Front, wearing the skin of romantic nationalism in order to push a proletarian revolution in the south of the country. This does not bode well for the coming years.
Occitan nationalism? What?
The Occitan People's Republic
Unrest among the socialist strata of society has hit a peak, with a large group of communist militants seceding in the south, proclaiming themselves to be the Occitan People's Republic.
Are you serious?
The Spanish Republican Movement

While the Bourbon Realm unified the two lines of the French and Spanish Bourbons, it did not resolve the unfortunate political disputes in Spain proper between the Carlists, the very same line on the throne of the Bourbon empire, and the liberal Christinos. Whereas in recent years the latter have increasingly moved their support away from royal squabbles and into the realm of liberal revolution, the divide continues to exist within our empire. With the character of our monarchy taking one distinctly separate from that of a Spanish nationality, the liberals in Spain have mounted a resistance to our rule, and undoubtedly will soon strike.
These fools again? We already won.
The Spanish Revolution

Despite the best efforts of the Bourbon realm, the unification process has been tenuous and slow, especially with fears across Spain that the union is taking on a character that will inevitably lead to full subjugation of the Spanish people under a French heel. This has unfortunately led to a great deal of liberal unrest in the Castilian section of the nation. As of now, this has now blown up into full-scale secessionist revolution against the government. We must put down this Spanish Republic immediately if we wish to secure the empire.
We will put this revolt down like any other.
The French National Front

Despite the best efforts of the Bourbon monarchy to keep the French people in line, fears of foreigner domination have come to dominate French society, and nationalists have taken the union as a great source of propaganda, showing off the Spanish character of the monarchs and the seeming preference for Spanish ways of life over those of France as a clear indication that the French people are under threat of foreign oppression, and by a people historically subservient to their interests, no less. These nationalists have come to form the French National Front, a paramilitary organization dedicated to ''liberating'' the French people from the Bourbon monarchy, and to establish a true nationalist republic in their wake. This does not bode well.
We will not let go of our crown.
The French National Republic

Despite our best efforts to maintain order among the French populace, the unrest caused by the French National Front has proved too great to contain. Riots have devolved into open rebellion against the central government, proclaiming for themselves a nationalist republic in Paris, and even taking to their cause a great deal of our own armed forces. Should we fail to put this down, we may well lose grip on the empire as a whole.
We will put this rabble down like before.
We can do nothing.
Integrating Poland

Ever since the Polish Partition, the Poles have long languished under foreign rule, including our own. However, whilst the Prussians and Russians have oppressed Poles to a great degree, the Austrian Empire has given to them a relatively light burden, compared to the struggles they face elsewhere. With the conquest of Poland complete, the kingdom can be integrated into the empire wholesale.
Dissolve Galicia, Integrate Poland.
The Restoration of Etrutia

The Kingdom of Etruria was a short-lived kingdom in the Italian peninsula, created by Napoleon I as a form of compensation to the Spanish line of Bourbon-Parma, and ultimately dissolved in 1815. With our success in overturning this aspect of the congress of Vienna, the kingdom can be restored, securing further Bourbon gains in the Italian peninsula.
The Treaty of Milan

The belligerent Sardinian kingdom has been defeated on the battlefield definitively, putting an end to their expansionist ambitions in the Italian peninsula. To ensure the continued security of both Austria and France, the state is to be effectively dismantled, its kindom split in twain, French majority regions handed back to the kingdom of France, and Genoa released once more as an independent republic.
This will undoubtedly bring stability.
Construction finished on Versailles

The Versailles Palace, after many years of reconstruction, renovation, and restoration, has finally been restored to working order, and the court culture of the palace has once again turned it into the diplomatic and cultural capital of Europe.
And all it took was our entire economy!
Renewing the Franco-Bavarian Alliance

Naturally, as the French court reasserts itself as the diplomatic axis around which Europe spins, one of the first matters to attend to is Germany. By strategically influencing and allying ourselves with the Bavarians once more, a feat much helped by their monarch's own romantic leanings, the Bourbons can drive a wedge into German affairs once again.
Naturally.
The Carlist War

The Liberals in Spain have defied our prior enforcement of the absolutist rule of the Bourbon line and brought about a pragmatic sanction to cement their own rule over our neighbor, denying Carlos the right to his rule. Catalans and Basque have rallied behind him to dispute this unlawful succession, and while we may stand by and do nothing, many in our administration advocate immediate intervention to secure a long term ally...
How many times do we need to teach you this lesson, old man?!
We have enough problems already.
Carlist War - French Victory

The unlawful Christinos have been deposed and French forces once again march triumphantly throughout Spain, bearing the banner of the French crown alongside the Burgundian Cross of Spain. Now, the question remains of how to administer our ally, whether to trust them to rule alone or to take more direct responsibility.
The crown is restored.
Keep Spain under surveillance.
Keep Spain controlled, and seize Cuba.
Carlist War - Spanish Victory
We have successfully repulsed even the French from our lands, preventing another repeat of the Bourbon tyranny within our lands.
Viva La Espana!
Codigo Abolicion Espanol

Throughout the history of the Spanish Empire, a large anti-slavery tract has existed, dating back to the early 1600s with declarations against the trade and laws forbidding the acquisition and sale of native americans as slaves. Despite multiple efforts to limit or abolish the trade and the practice on the part of the Spanish state, due to political realities and extensive contraband slaves still arrive to Cuba in record numbers, and the political opposition of Cuban slaveholders still drastically influences Spanish policy. With continued political reforms, an opportunity has arisen to finally abolish the trade and practice across the empire, fulfilling the obligations Spain made to abolishing the practice in 1820.
We must destroy the trade at all costs.
Carlist Distributism - Cuba

Distributist measures taken in the Spanish mainland have thus far proven quite successful, prompting some in the more abolitionist camp of government to propose expanding the program well beyond the shores of Spain proper, and to extend it to the colonial holdings of Cuba and Puerto Rico as well. To do so would cost a great investment from the Spanish coffers, but could prove invaluable to recovering the island possessions' respective economies in the aftermath of abolition by handing landed estates to freed slaves and to those peninsulares whom have yet to benefit on the mainland. However, this will doubtlessly earn further ire from former slaveholders on the islands, and may yet prove another challenge for Spanish authorities.
What a brilliant idea!
Who cares about the islands?
The Barbarization Plan

The Barbarization Plan was a supposed plan to enslave, kill, and deport the vast majority of Greeks in the mainland of Greece in order to repopulate the region with settlers from the Levant and Egypt. While this was never officially acknowleged by the Turkish government, a combination of massacres, pogroms, and atrocities in Ottoman held territory, as well as private statements by generals involved in the campaign, highly suggest that this plan, or at least a variation of it, would have been enacted in the event of an Ottoman victory. The cities of the empire are purged of their Hellene inhabitants, civilians, soldiers, bureaucrats all alike purged from their posts, dislanded, and most even enslaved. Massacres accompany the Turkish reprisals, further pogroms being enacted in Constantinople, Trebizond, and all other territories the Ottomans retain. As slaves are deported across the whole of Greece, Arabs from Egypt and the Levant, particularly those who aided in putting an end to the rebellion, are given the land in their stead. This event has been condemned across the whole of Europe, but the powers of the west have already proven their ineffectual nature in preventing an Ottoman reconquest. Even so, there are few left whom they can carry the torch for. Almost certainly, this is the end of the Hellenic peoples of the world, and the end of their civilization as a whole.
Such are the wages of rebellion.
Collapse of Ottoman Authority

The complete and utter defeat of the Sultan's armies by the rebellious Greek uprising came as a shock to the world, which just a few short years earlier had to intervene to prevent the complete defeat of the Greeks. The capture of Constantinople by the rebellion led to a total breakdown of civil authority across the Ottoman empire, and in this defeat the Ottoman Empire has been reduced to naught but a rump state in Anatolia.
At least we don't have to worry about minorities anymore.
Retribution

The Greek uprising against the Ottomans was a bloody one, characterized by a distinct lack of mercy on both sides. In Greek-occupied territory, Turks were hunted down and killed until there were none left, and the same sort of action characterized the Turkish war effort. The brutality of the war was unspeakable, with families whom had known each other for years not being spared from the ethnic and religious turmoil that engulfed the former Ottoman Empire in the event of the Filiki Etarias assuming control. With the success of the Greek rebellion, the Turkish people left stranded in Rhomaion territory are ill-prepared for the death that arrives at their doorstep, and unlike when the Ottomans persecuted the Greeks, there is little chance or will for outside intervention. For those Muslims that find themselves in Greek territory, shut doors and hushed whispers are their only defense against the bloody retribution that faces them and their children, deserved or not. The Rhomaion speak of the Saint Virgin Mary granting them a mandate to destroy the entirety of the Turkish civilization, and the Bosporus runs red with the bloated, decaying bodies of men, women, and children murdered within the city walls and dumped into the Bosporus. Ottoman forces that otherwise would have intervened are nowhere to be found, or their disorganized remnants have joined the civilians in being massacred.
But they deserve it, right?
The Basileia Tos Rhomaion

The Filiki Etarias has succeeded in the goal it set out for itself in the Greek revolution, despite all attempts by the Turks to defeat it and by foreign powers to limit it. The Rhomaion people now forge their own destiny on the world stage, a restoration of the glory of the ancient peoples of Rome imagined in the modern day, and an overturning of the disaster of 1453. The Empire of the Romans will suffer many tribulations in the years to come, but this will always be remembered as the day the peoples of Rome saw their final liberation from the Ottoman yoke.
The Empire of Kings has returned.
The Countryside War

Despite military victory, and an official treatise with the Ottoman Empire concerning their expulsion from Europe and from much of Anatolia, the reality on the ground is far less cut and dry. Turkish gendarmie and partisans still roam much of the countryside, raiding and invading territories across the mutual border. On the European side, Albanian bandits and Bulgarian nationalists on our side of the border still engage in military resistance against the empire. Without comprehensive investment in the army, there is little that can be done to prevent further bloodshed.
I thought the war was over?
The Klephts

Useful to the cause of rebellion was a class of people in the countryside known as the Klephts. Opposed to Ottoman rule, these partisans proved exceptionally useful in securing Greek independence. However, with the hostilities ceased, even if only in name, the klephts have become problematic. Little more than thieving bandits, they comprise a large portion of the Rhomaion armed forces, and use their position to extract bribes from the local populace, as well as obfuscate corrupt dealings behind the prestige of their status as 'war heroes.' If the Rhomaion state is to modernize, the klephts must be reigned into state control and their corruption ceased, one way or another.
I kinda like the bribes
Phanariote Corruption

The Phanariote class, during the reign of the Ottoman Empire, made up a substantial portion of the administration of the Ottoman provinces, and even took charge of a large portion of the merchant class and aristocracy. Now, with independence secured, the Phanariote class has established its own control over much of the bureaucracy. Skilled diplomats and administrators all, their benefits would be felt throughout the state, if their skills were applied more to administration and less to lining their own pockets.
More bribes?
Rouspheti Traditions

The bureaucracy of the Rhomaion state inherits certain predispositions regarding how the bureaucracy should function, most notably how the wheels of the state should turn. State officials routinely accept Rouspheti, that is to say, gifts and bribes, in order to move policy in favor of those who pay, or simply to move the state at all. This has resulted in a deeply backwards, bloated, and slow state apparatus. It will take time, effort, and much investment to change this cultural outlook amongst the bureaucracy.
MORE BRIBES?!
The State Within the State

The Orthodox Church remains a powerful institution within the Rhomaion empire, and its power is unmatched in matters ecclesiastical. Normally a source of great prestige for the country, the power of the church is worrisome in how far it extends into the realm of the political. A landed body in and of itself, the church takes a powerful position within the affairs of state, proving more often than not to be a roadblock to meaningful change in the path to modernization. Until this issue is settled, in favor of the church or of the state, the status quo benefits few in the realm.
God Willing!
The Kojdabashi

The Kojdabashi are an aristocratic class in the Rhomaion state, dating back to before the acquisition of the empire by the Turks in the 15th century. The aristocratic class is one that is deeply engrained in the social strata of the state, and plays a large role in the organization of the Rhomaion empire. Opposed thoroughly to the merchant classes of the state, this strata will work tirelessly to prevent the industrialization of the realm until it is reigned in, by one means or another.
They will be curbed in time.
The Commerce Monopoly

The Phanariotes have another realm in which they govern much of our state, namely the world of commerce. Phanariote vessels control a majority share of virtually all external trade heading into and out of the realm, leaving us deeply dependent on their cooperation...and therefore, lining their pockets.
At least we can still get bananas.
Coastal Piracy

Despite our victory over the Ottoman Empire, coastal piracy remains a major threat to the security of the empire in Constantinople. Egyptian, Meghrebi, and even several Ottoman vessels still plague our coaastline as if the war never ended, raiding coastal settlements and taking the population as captives. Without a large naval presence in the Aegean, there is little we can do to stop this.
That has got to be the worst pirate I've ever seen.
An Empire of Rot

While the state we have created bears the title of the ancient empire of the Romans, its status only exists as a mere pale reflection of the glories of old. Without a powerful army to speak of, politically divided, economically and societally backwards, and lacking all but the most core regions of the Rhomaion state, our nation stands as an empire of rot, inheritor of the very same deformities that plagued our oppressors.
Oh, my empire of dirt!
The End of the Countryside War

With the enlargement of the Rhomaion army into a force of sizable stature, the empire is finally in a position to force an end to the raids and unrest that has plagued the countryside thus far. With the Anatolian frontier finally under control, a decision must be come to as to how we must approach the remaining Turkish presence in Roman Anatolia.
Send the remainder across the border, peacefully of course.
They can remain, under supervision.
Disempowering the Klephts

The Klephts have for a long time been a problematic thorn in the side of the Rhomaion military structure, a corrupt bunch of bandits and thieves that use their status in the military in order to extract substantial bribes. With recent investment into the command of the Rhomaion army, the choice is now ours on how to proceed dealing with these corrupt war heroes.
Integrate the Klephts as a gendarme
Disown and purge the Klephts.
Reigning in the Phanariotes

The Phanariotes have played a large role in the diplomacy and administration of the realm. With our investments into the financial and dipomatic realms bearing fruit, we now have the opportunity to face down their corruption, and make a decision on how to address this class of diplomats moving forwards, and how we can use their diplomatic strengths to benefit us.
Their diplomatic expertise proves handy.
We prefer a more aggressive strand of diplomacy.
Undoing the Rouspheti Tradition

The Rouspheti tradition, the exchanging of gifts and personal favors in order to keep the wheels of state turning, is one that has remained pervasive across Rhomaion society until recently. Now, however, with the modernizing of the state and cultural apparatus of the empire, the tradition can be done away with and replaced with a more favorable tradition for the realm...
Their corruption can be useful to increase funding.
Efficiency at all costs!
Of Church and State

The Orthodox church during Ottoman rule served as the only government entity of the old Byzantine empire that survived in its totality, and as such grew immensely in power as the sole representative of the Rhomaion people during the Turkish occupation. This status quo has left the cultural institutions of the empire in a standstill. Now, with investment having been made to this field of the nation, a decision can be made as to where the church will stand in the nation going forwards.
The Empire is absolute.
The Church is absolute.
Reigning the Kodjabashi

The Kodjabashi, a class of nobility that date to the Ottoman takeover of the old Rhomaion empire, have maintained until now a large share of the economy and political class of the state. Hardcore traditionalists, their interests are directly opposed to industrial expansion. With substantial investment in the industrial economy, we now have a position to force the issue and end their control.
Integrate them and grant them noble titles.
Cast them out, we must modernize!
The Phanariote Commerce Monopoly

The Phanariotes until now have enjoyed a comprehensive monopoly on the commerce of the Rhomaion realm, and as such have effectively revoked state control over its own foreign commerce. With investment having been made in the economy of the realm, Phanariote control has eroded enough to determine what to do with their class moving forwards.
Their monopoly could be useful.
Let me just get my hammer...
The End of Coastal Piracy

The last of the coastal pirates in the Aegean have been done away with, and their equipment and leadership has been seized by the state. Now, the only question left is what we must do with the bountiful harvest we have captured from them.
THAT HAS GOT TO BE THE BEST PIRATE IVE EVER SEEN
Pirate Expertise? Go home, you're drunk.
Coastline Raided!
The accursed pirates raiding our coastline have struck again, burning and looting settlements before dispersing by the time any reinforcements could arrive.
That has got to be the worst pirate I've ever seen.
An Empire of Bronze

The Empire of the Rhomaion marches onwards. Still a backwards nation in many ways, glimmers of hope yet still arise, illuminating the potential for recovery and growth. Now is the time of rebuilding and consolidating, so that these glimmers may yet become a reality.
Bronze Age Jumpscare
Thrace Protected

With the acquisition of Northern Thrace and Macedonia, the northern border of the empire has stabilized, at least for now. With the proverbial foot in the door, the Basileia Tos Rhomaion can begin to take a leading role in Balkan affairs.
Let's hope it isn't cut off.
An Empire of Silver

The Basileia Tos Rhomaion is finally beginning to resemble, if not a truly modern state, a functioning one with landed institutions and some vestiges of economic and military prowess begining to show. Even if the realm may not yet rise to the forefront of geopolitical affairs, it is at least worthy of consideration at this point.
An empire of spoons and forks, silverware for all.
Bulgaria Reclaimed

Bulgaria, the long-standing rival of the Byzantine empire, has been vanquished by the Rhomaion people once again, as they were during the reign of Basil II. With this border secured, the empire of the Romans can finally call its northern border that of the Danube again, for the first time since six hundred years ago.
The name "Bulgar-slayer" ring any bells?
Western Balkans Reclaimed!

The western balkans, historically the northern frontier of the Byzantine empire, have finally been reclaimed by their rightful owners, bringing the Orthodox peoples of the region back together for the first time since before the 4th Crusade.
Unity at last.
Anatolia Retaken

The Anatolian frontier, after centuries of Islamic, Turkish rule, has been restored to the Rhomaion people finally. Further has the empire marched now than it ever has since the days of the Komnenos dynasty, and this territorial restoration has exceeded even Manuel Komnenos' efforts to recover the hinterlands of the peninsula. Surely, further glories must await us after this day.
Nice borders.
An Empire of Marble

The Basileia Tos Rhomaion, finally, enters the world stage not as a ruinous shadow of its former self, not as a secondary member of negotiations mentioned only in passing, but as a true power. While they still refer to the nation as the "Empire of the Greeks," and most typically refuse to recognize the title claimed by the empire, slowly but surely public opinion is beginning to sway in favor of the latter.
So close...
Armenia Reclaimed

The lands of Armenia have been reclaimed in their entirety, bringing the foremost provinces of the realm that were lost in the battle of Manzikert back under Imperial control. With these lands integrated, the issue of Armenian nationalism has been brought into question for perhaps the first time since the peoples were integrated into the bureaucracy. The once rather negligible minorities of Georgians and Armenians have become sizable expanses of the nation, and their calls for independence, which once aided our conquests, have become thorns in our own side. While their fears can be alleviated by integrating their languages fully into the imperial state apparatus, this will come at severe cost to our administrative efficiency. We must ask ourselves now, is the Empire Rhomaion, or are its people?
The people are Rhomaion!
The Empire is Rhomaion!
An Empire of Gold

The Rhomaion Empire, a title for long that has languished in the face of opposition from those that would deny the people of Constantinople its prestige and honor, has finally reclaimed its place at the forefront of the world stage. The title of "Roman" has gone from a formality to a colloquialism of diplomatic discourse, no longer a proclamation or a title but rather a statement of mere reality, and the cultural exchange of what once was called Hellenic has become a prestigious and well-regarded tradition, one many would be proud to inherit. The Empire has been restored.
A Pax Romana Restored!
The Levant Reclaimed

Heraclius spoke of the Levant in the 600s, after suffering a disastrous defeat at the hands of the Islamic Caliphate, and he said of the territory that it was a beautiful province, and that it would serve the caliphs well. His prediction proved to be quite apt. The Muslims took great use of these lands, and our empire languished in their absence. With the restoration of these lands into the empire, however, comes the integration of more christianized populations, populations that will undoubtedly seek their own rights within the empire as well.
We will integrate them.
We embrace our fellow Christians!
The Jewel Reclaimed!

The Jewel of the Rhomaion Empire, the breadbasket of Egypt, has been reclaimed in the name of God and of the Rhomaion peoples. The territory that once served as the breadbasket for the Rhomaiin empire fell not long after the Levant did, and its reacquisition will once again turn this fertile land into the same breadbasket it once was. Meanwhile, the local Copts have proven to be a possible point by which the empire can appeal to the locals, however, this will once again severely strain the bureaucracy of the empire, and will no doubt be unpopular in so far as the state will be giving preferential tratment to a distinct minority of the Egyptian populace.
We will accept them, as long as they become Rhomaion.
We accept all Christians.
The Thassos Dispute

The island of Thassos, populated only by peoples of the Rhomaion realm, was occupied by the Egyptians during our war of independence, and to this day the Egyptians administer it how they wish. This island is strategically placed directly to the south of our Macedonian holdings, and allows Egypt to project their navy all along the coastline, as well as harbor the very pirates that threaten our realm now. We may demand the island be returned to us, and the Egyptians vacate the land, but undoubtedly they will have demands of their own, seeing as Ali has had ambitions on our land since the war of independence.
We will demand the island be returned.
This sounds like a terrible idea.
The Hellenes Demand Thassos

The Hellenic peoples, high off of their successes against the rotting Ottoman Empire, have dained to demand the island of Thassos, which we have occupied since 1813 as a just reward for fending off the Wahhabists in Arabia. While the island is of little worth on its own, escalating this dispute by posing an outrageous price for the island may be an apt decision on our own part, allowing us to seize substantially more territory should they refuse and negotiations break down...
Demand Cyprus and Crete in return!
We do not want war with the Hellenes. The island is worth little, anyways.
Egyptian Demands

The treacherous Egyptians have demanded the islands of Cyprus and Crete in return for the island of Thassos! The deal they offer is undoubtedly a horrendously high price for the land we seek, and undoubtedly is being forwarded in order to force a breakdown of negotiations. Should we refuse this offer, Egypt will most certainly seek war in order to take far more than just those two islands from us.
Damn it all, give them what they want.
Break the negotiations, then.
The Return of Thassos

Unexpectedly, the Egyptians have backed down from the island of Thassos, and have benevolently granted us control of the island for no cost at all. Egyptian naval vessels and military personnel have begun to evacuate the island, and the transfer of civilian authority to Rhomaion governors has begun to take place across the small island, ensuring a safe transition of power between our two realms. Surely they are intimidated by our invincible military might!
How nice of them.
Greece Breaks Negotiations!

As expected, the Greeks have broken off negotiations, and their response to our 'generous' offer was one of disdain, clearly insulted by the boldness of our demands. With negotiations breaking down, we now have a valid cause to go to war, in order to maintain our honor in the Mediterranean, as well as what rewards defending it brings.
To War!
On second thought, they can keep the island.
The War is Going Poorly

The war against the Hellenes is going substantially worse than expected. Our armies are distinctly outnumbered by the Hellenic forces they face off against, whether because of our own lack of preparation or due to defeats on the battlefield, or a combination of both. Victory as we sought it is unlikely to come to us, and we no longer have the capacity to keep the island under our control, let alone expand into Greece as was intended. It would be apt to cut our losses and pursue peace with them, so that we may lick our wounds in peace.
The war is lost.
They have but shaved our beard.
The Egyptians Surrender!

The Egyptians have begun forwarding diplomatic feelers, bringing up the possibility of an end to hostilities, and an Egyptian withdrawal from the island of Thassos to end this bloody conflict. Undoubtedly, their nose has been bloodied in a bout that they did not expect to go this poorly, and they seek a quick exit from a war they stand little chance of winning now. We ourselves may not be in a much better position, so perhaps it would be wise to accept this offer of peace, lest the war go south going forwards.
The war is concluded. Accept their offer.
They think it's only the island we want now? Cute.
The Egyptians Defeated

The Egyptians have been defeated both on sea and on land, in a stunning victory many would have deemed impossible, same as how many would have deemed it impossible that the Turks would have been defeated. Their armies have been devastated both on sea and on land, and the government of Ali has been forced to acknowledge the supremacy of the armies of Rhomania on the field, and pay substantial indemnities to our state in return for the cessation of hostilities. The island of Thassos has been reclaimed, and the experience this war has brought, fighting against an army on modern european lines, will prove invaluable to our developing nation going forwards.
The Pharoah's Staff is Broken.
The Hellenes Have Surrendered

The Hellenic 'empire' has surrendered as expected to our markedly superior military forces, and has been forced to give up its territory in the Aegean, as well as their lands in Attica and the Peloponnese, which the Ottomans promised to us as compensation for aiding him against the Hellenic rebellion that ended their empire. These territories now belong to Egypt, a foothold for Ali on the European continent.
The Hellenes have been crushed, as expected.
A Minor Victory

The Egyptians have been thwarted in their attempts to conquer our realm, although we have proven incapable of forcing any terms on them. Their forces have steadily begun to withdraw from Thassos, as their outpost there has come to be a needless expense in the face of our opposition on the continent. While no treaty may have been signed to end this war, and no territory has been officially exchanged, this ends the Egyptian occupation of Thassos for the foreseeable future.
The island is ours!
The Lazican Uprising

Upon the acquisition of the Lazican territory by the revived Rhomaion state, it was initially presumed that the local Lazicans would accept Rhomaion rule rather easily, considering their cultural heritage as part of the Georgian realm, which enjoyed strong relations with the Rhomaion peoples for many years in its heyday. However, the local population has long since converted to Islam, and quickly it has been found that they do not associate strongly with the renewed order in the Trebizod region. They have begun to agitate heavily for independence from the realm, organizing into militias to oppose imperial rule, and it is not unlikely that shots will be fired soon.
We must keep order.
The Balkan Revolution

With the fall of Constantinople into Greek hands, the Turkish yoke over the whole of the Balkan world is ending. Premier amongst the new entities arising from local entities is that of Bulgaria, the traditional powerhouse of the Danube, and most likely the future rival to Byzantine expansion. The Turks across the whole of Bulgaria flee inevitable persecution, taking what they can and being led alongside what Ottoman authorities remain in a retreat to Anatolia. The loss of life in this operation is remarkably minimal, thanks to the efforts of a certain Turkish officer in the region, whom facilitated an organized evacuation campaign of the civilians, using what soldiers the Ottoman government had left.
Freedom at last!
The Balkan Revolution

With the fall of Constantinople into Greek hands, the peoples of the Balkans have become free from the Turkish yoke, and one of the largest benefactors of this destruction is that of the Serbian peoples. The Serbians have always been of a rebellious stature amongst the Balkan subjects of the Ottomans, and with the loss of Turkish authority all pretenses of loyalty to the Sultan have been cast aside. In a last ditch effort, the Ottoman authorities, rallied by a remarkable model of Ottoman military command, have vacated the region, taking as many civilians with them as humanly possible, si as to spare them from the horrors that would undoubtedly await those families unlucky enough to remain.
Freedom at last!
The Ottoman Collapse

The loss of Constantinople has proven devastating to the Turkish realm. Nearly all of the empire's bureaucratic resources were invested in the city and its placement as the imperial capital of the empire. The Hellene revolutionaries, upon breaching its walls, were able to systematically eradicate the capacity of the empire to govern its vast territories, causing the de facto end of the Ottoman empire as it had been built since the 1400s, and the Sultan's line went missing in this time, presumed dead. This devastating collapse was only mitigated by the consolidation of Turkish forces in the interior by a particular officer, whose efforts saved many lives in what was otherwise a horrific event in Turkish history. Now, the government must regroup and reorganize.
The end is surely upon us!
The Janissaries Seize Control

The Janissary corps, a previously dissolved and disowned military organization in the Ottoman government, now remains as one of the few bodies with officials left alive and intact following the collapse of the administration. Seizing this opportunity, these disgraced remnants of the body that once caused so much harm to the administration in years past has taken control of the reins of state, forming a provisional government so as to decide the future of the realm.
This can only end poorly.
The Coronation of a New Sultan

The Janissary provisional government has wasted no time in selecting a new Sultan from among its own ranks, an officer whose position had survived the purge in 1830, and whose actions in the aftermath of the collapsing Ottoman war effort saved a great deal of Turkish lives. The man in recent months became something of a folk hero, a clearly popular and obvious choice for the organization whose legitimacy rests on a knife's edge. This sultan is coronated in a swift and inglorious manner, much of the regalia of the Ottoman court resting still within the city of Constantinople, which is now almost certainly eternally lost to the Turkish people now.
This couldn't possibly reverse our fortunes.
The Janissaries Reinstated

The Janissaries, those that placed the Sultan in power, may have expected initially that they would be awarded for their actions with prestigious positions in the new government, and a renewal of their rights and priviliges as existed before the Great Purge in the 20s. In return for their efforts, however, the Sultan instigated a series of military reforms of the empire, designed to bring it up to par with Western militaries despite its greatly reduced size. The Janissaries are indeed given positions in this military structure, but no longer as the armed combatants in separate roles they had once enjoyed. Rather, they form a new officer corps, serving to train and lead the standard armies of the empire in battle, trained in modern schools of warfare, ofen by foreign emissaries invited into the realm. As a depoliticized class, they no longer have the power to threaten the empire's integrity, but their desire for reward has been satiated.
Intriguing.
Central Anatolian Population Boom

The Sultan that has come to power has followed up his successful military reforms with comprehensive reforms of the state and social structure. One major factor of his efforts has been land reform. Particularly, he has engaged in efforts to grant plots of land and housing to those refugees that have fled from the Balkan territories of the empire, and has engaged in highly pro-natalist policies in order to recover the vastly diminished popualtion of the state.
The population will recover.
Rumi Administrative Reform

The Rumi Sultan has engaged in further reforms of the administration, particularly aimed at increasing the efficiency of the realms straggling bureaucratic apparatus. By enlisting the aid of foreign legal experts, and staffing the intelligentsia of the realm with those well versed in education, the bureaucracy of this period is soon proving to be the envy of the world.
Efficiency, efficiency, efficiency!
The Ionian Islands Settlement

The Ionian Islands are a chain of islands off the west coast of the mainland, inhabited almost entirely by fellow Rhomaion civilians. During the Napoleonic Wars, the islands were occupied by Britain in order to secure naval bases in the Mediterranean. However, with our empire falling into their very own sphere of influence, the continued British presence is proving rather unnecessary. We should forward a request to have the islands transferred back to us as a show of good will.
Send the request.
The Hellenes Request the Ionian Islands

In recent days since the self-proclaimed Rhomaion Empire fell under our protection, probing diplomatic feelers have been sent out, addressing the matter of the Ionian Islands. An island chain taken during the Napoleonic Wars, these territories posit little value to us, and releasing them into Hellene custody would be a great gesture of good will to the international community.
Hand the lands back.
No.
The Ionian Settlement

The British have graciously handed back the Ionian Island chain to us, after a short negotiations process. This will surely usher in an era of unprecedented cooperation between the Rhomaion people and the British crown.
Huzzah!
The British Refuse!
The British have refused us our rightful possessions in the Ionian Islands. There is little we can do without risking war against the British.
The Islands are lost.
The Ionian Islands Seized!

As relations between our realm and the Hellene empire have soured, increasingly fears arose that the station in the Ionian islands would be the target of hostile operations against the British Empire. However, not many expected the sheer audacity of the operation that they engaged in. Our stations in the region, ill-defended as they were, were quickly overrun by Greek forces, accompanied by sympathetic locals. While these territories are of little value to us, and recognizing this territorial change can cool relations, this will undoubtedly constitute a humiliation, even if we planned to abandon the territories anyhow.
Abandon the islands.
Even if we cant reclaim them, this insult cannot go unpunished.
The Patriarchate of Antioch

The Patriarchate of Antioch was long one of the main churches of the Orthodox creed, a piece of the Pentarchy that once governed all of Christianity as a united faith. The city fell to the Islamic invasions alongside the other parts of the pentarchy, but was the only city to ever be reclaimed, even if briefly, by the Rhomaion empire in years past. Now, the city passes once again into our hands, and an Orthodox patriarch now governs over the city.
The city is ours!
The City of Jerusalem

The City of Jerusalem was once a proud member of the Pentarchy, the body of churches that once governed the whole of the Christian world as one. The city wherein Jesus preached and the very same wherein he was unjustly crucified, the city holds a special place in the hearts of all true Christians. Taken by the Islamic Caliphate first amongst all of the holy cities, it has seen much war and death in various struggles to claim the holy city. Now, it passes once again into Rhomaion hands, where it belongs.
And may it never be lost again.
The City of Alexandria

The City of Alexandria has long held a special place in the hearts of the Rhomaion people. Built by Alexander the Great in times immemorial, the city has been a center of Greek culture dating ever since, a major center of the Christian church, and indeed the heart and soul of the Empire it resided under. The city, until the construction of Constantinople, even served as the de facto capital of the eastern empire itself, a center of trade, commerce, and the latest piece of the Pentarchy restored to prominence under Imperial control.
The city of Alexander passes to us.
The City of Rome

A dream that was once deemed impossible has come to fruition, in a manner none could have ever predicted to become reality. The city of Rome itself, long the capital of the Roman Empire that we have restored, and replaced by the city of Constantinople, the city was lost to us before even the Levant, but not to the Islamic Caliphate. The city and seat of the Papacy, the city of Rome yet still remains the seat of one of the Pentarchs, no matter how wayward its leadership was in past centuries.
Home at last!
The Pentarchy Restored!

Something that never would have entered the wildest dreams of Rhomaion emperors since the days of Justinian himself. For the first time in centuries, all five seats of the ancient pentarchy of the Christian church have been reunited. While this may not heal the wounds in the faith that have opened for so long, but the authority of the Orthodox church and its role as the primary head of the Christian world cannot be disputed.
Reunited!
The Rhomaion Provisional Government

The victory in the revolution was merely the first step in the long road to independence for the Rhomaion people. While victory against the external foes of the state has been achieved, the matter of internal divisions and threats from within is far from settled. The empire is at a crossroads, as the provisional government set up in past years to carry the nation through its revolution is coming to an end. There are many whose interests clash with one another as to what course the empire should take going forwards. This debate will have existential implications for the empire going forwards. Whose vision should the empire adhere to?
Kolokotronis of the Russian Faction, of course.
The Course of the Nation

The nomination of Kolokotronis as the head of the Rhomaion state's future has cemented the role many in the west had already feared the independent state would take: a firm advocate of partnership with Russia, Kolokotronis has closely aligned the state with the interests of the Orthodox east, and alongside the aristocracy seeks to ensure the continuation of the age old alliance dating back to the middle ages. Already, Russian support is pouring in, and the gifts of many Russian nobility happy to see the restoration of a Roman empire to their south have bolstered our own economy.
Orthodoxy Stands United!
Alexander The Heir

Kolokotronis, a firm advocate of monarchism, still remains less than amenable to the forgoing of his own political power to an upstart candidate whom could undo his efforts to unify and stabilize the new Rhomaion realm. As such, a candidate for the throne of the Rhomaion kingdom has been difficult to find amongst suitable Russian nobility, despite efforts to appease the benefactors of Constantinople. Ultimately, a decision was reached to place the young Nicholas Constantovich upon the throne. His rule is currently placed under a regency, headed of course by Kolokotronis, until such time as he comes of age.
May his reign be just, when it comes.
The Coronation of Nicholas I Constantovich

The day has finally come, wherein the king Nicholas will be crowned ruler of the Rhomaion Kingdom. Having come of age, and spending six months in preparation for the day he would finally be crowned, the king was crowned in front of a large crowd in front of the Hagia Sophia, to acclaim by the many Rhomaion people within its walls. Having insisted strongly that the affair be as prestigious and entertaining as possible, this coronation has come at the severe expense of the state, and it is reported that after his coronation he spent many hours courting with the various women of the capital, some of whom were married to prominent aristocrats of the kingdom.
He only just got crowned, he'll get over it.
The HMS Marlborough

Ever since the Rhomaion Kingdom made clear its close ties to the Russian Empire, British ships have been closed off from the Bosporus strait, and the Mediterranean itself has been open to Russian warships. Britain, always keen on undoing this treaty, has apparently chosen that the best course of action is to flaunt its restrictions on their own fleet, keeping warships stationed near our waters. Today, the HMS Marlborough was fired upon after drawing too close to a coastal battery, and the British have swiftly responded with a demand to open the Bosporus to British warships and to close it off from Russia, a move which would effectively cut Rhomaion ties from its mother country.However, to refuse would be to potentially draw the ire of one of the largest powers on the planet.
We must give in.
They think us cowards?
The Rhomaion Kingdom Closes the Straits!

Terrible news has arrived to St Petersburg: the Rhomaion kingdom, under pressure from the British, has closed the Turkish straits to Russian warships! Without taking action now, the Balkans could fall under British influence, barring Russia from overseas ambitions.
We must intervene!
There is nothing we can do.
The Greeks Stand Defiant!

Despite our threats, the Greek Empire refuses to acknowledge our supremacy of arms. Should we engage them in battle, the Russians will undoubtedly intervene. However, success could see the breakup of this upstart realm.
Show them our strength.
Put this matter aside for now.
The End of Kolokotronis

The program of the Rhomaion Kingdom set forth by Kolokotronis has been put to an end by the acts of foreigners and revolutionaries. The thread of his leadership has been severed and no more can be said for the future of this state.
Woe is Rome!
Nicholas the Scoundrel

As the years drag on, Nicholas has increasingly taken on himself a reputation as a womanizer and a disastrous presence within the royal court. His constant womanizing, brash demeanor, and disrespect for court officials makes him a laughingstock on the world stage, and therefore makes us a shame on the world stage as well. Even marriage has not stopped him from having several public affairs, and yet he is unable to even secure a divorce to salvage what little dignity he has.
Maybe this was a mistake.
Nicholas the Terrible

Nicholas grows ever more burdensome to the kingdom he is meant to rule. The man swings around his royal prerogative on a regular basis such as to secure his continued wasteful life, no matter how much it drains the kingdom's coffers. All whom question him are immediately removed from the court, moveements against his rule are put down with vicious severity, and he increasingly takes on the role of a despot unseen since the late terrible Ottoman sultans before him, and his health, both physical and mental, appears to be in rapid freefall.
Please spare us his stupidity...
Nicholas the Mad

As things could not possibly grow any worse for the Basileia Tos Rhomaion, the Tsar of this country has grown extensively ill. A madness has overtaken him as late, leading all of his worst impulses to rise to the surface, leaving him a rambling buffoon incapable of leadership. Even so, the power he wields has left the nation in horrid straits...
God save us, for no-one else can.
The Mad Heretic

The opposition of the church hierarchy to the rule of the Tsar has grown ever more apparent as his madness grows. Even the mad Tsar is not unaware of this, and as of late he has begun using his royal prerogative over the church to begin forcing alterations to doctrine, doubtlessly in a mad bout to further damage the church in the eyes of the public.
Banish all Icons!
War! War to all infidels!
The wolf is a saint!
Im makin waffles!
The Patriarch's Coup

For long enough the patriarch suffered the madness of the king, for the church remained secure even with the wastefulness of the mad king. However, as the king's madness and paranoia grew, leading him to suspect treachery and treason wherever shadows crossed his path, he began to attempt to assert his royal prerogative upon the church that played such a crucial role in his administration. Using the extensive powers invested in the Orthodox Church, Neophytus VIII has maneuevered the court around the madman, leaving the Tsar finally and completely powerless.
Long Live the Church!
The Tsar Institutionalized!

The Tsar's ill health of mind and body has grown increasingly apparent to even those closest to him. In time, it was his own son that saw to it the end of the mad king. Nicholas shall be interned in a small estate near Adrianople for the rest of his days, while the pieces are picked up from the mess he left behind by his progeny. The age of the mad Tsar is at an end.
The sins of the father are not easily undone.
The Death of the Tsar

Ultimately, no matter how powerful the Mad Tsar was in the state or in the church, there was one enemy he could never use his royal prerogative to combat, that of the ravages of time and disease. The cancer in his brain finally taking its toll, Nicholas breathed his last on this day. His son succeeds him, and it is only left in question whether he wishes to keep the reforms of his father in place, or undo the mad kings rule once and for all.
Tyranny no more.
Some of these reforms are useful...
